required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 68Ga-grazytracer PET/CT in Subjects With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer or Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: 68Ga-grazytracer PET/CT of Tumor Responses to Immunotherapy in Subjects With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer or Melanoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label positron emission tomography/computed tomography (PET/CT) study to investigate the clinical predictive value of 68Ga-grazytracer in subjects with non-small cell lung cancer or melanoma receiving immune checkpoint inhibitors (e.g., Ipilimumab, Nivolumab). A single dose of 2.96 MBq/kg body weight of 68Ga-grazytracer will be injected intravenously. The visual and semiquantitative methods will be used to assess the PET/CT images.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators recently developed a granzyme B-specific radiotracer named 68Ga-grazytracer. This clinical trial aims to investigate whether granzyme B PET imaging using 68Ga-grazytracer could early identify tumor responses to immune checkpoint inhibitory cancer therapy in subjects with non-small cell lung cancer or melanoma. PET/CT imaging of 68Ga-grazytracer will be performed in subjects before and after receiving immune checkpoint inhibitors.

primary_outcome.description: Visual analysis of 68Ga-grazytracer PET images will be performed by consensus reading by at least 3 experienced nuclear medicine physician.
The standardized uptake values (SUVs) of 68Ga-grazytracer in lesions will be measured by the same nuclear medicine physician for all the cases

other_outcome.measure: Granzyme B expression analysis of tumor tissues
other_outcome.description: Tumor tissues obtained from biopsy or surgery will be stained for granzyme B

other_outcome.measure: Correlation analysis of 68Ga-grazytracer uptake and lesion size changes
other_outcome.description: The SUVs of 68Ga-grazytracer in individual lesions will be compared to the changes in lesion sizes

arm_group.description: Participants who have not undergone immunotherapy will be injected with 2.96 MBq/kg body weight of 68Ga-grazytracer in one dose intravenously and then undergo PET/CT scan within 1 h.
Participants post-immunotherapy will be injected with 2.96 MBq/kg body weight of 68Ga-grazytracer in one dose intravenously and then undergo PET/CT scan within 1 h.

intervention.description: 68Ga-grazytracer PET/CT: after intravenous injection of 2.96 MBq/kg body weight of quality-controlled 68Ga-grazytracer, a Siemens Biograph PET/CT scan will be applied within 1 h, and the scan range will be from the top of the head to 1/3 of the upper thigh.
